sik.client.admin
Class RecordsGUIListener

java.lang.Object
  sik.client.admin.RecordsGUIListener
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener
public class RecordsGUIListener
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.io.Serializable

A class solely for handling the events made in the Records GUI

Author:
Jamie Brindle (06352322) - Manchester Metropolitan University *

Action event handler

refreshRecordPointer

private void refreshRecordPointer()
Calls two method which set the 'mode' of the navigation control pointers based on pointer index of the student records store i.e. If pointing to the first student record in the student records store there's no need for the 'last' and 'previous' navigation buttons to be enabled, as there is no 'last' and 'previous' pointer from this point, so disable them. This method will also re-enable navigation buttons appropriately

loadAssignRFIDTagGUI

public void loadAssignRFIDTagGUI()
                          throws com.phidgets.PhidgetException
Run the GUI to assign an RFID serial number to a student record

Throws:
com.phidgets.PhidgetException - If there are any problems with the RFID scanner (connection or hardware related)

loadChangeRMILocationDialog

private void loadChangeRMILocationDialog()
Creates and runs a dialog which allows the user to change the set RMI location to connect to

executeCorrectFileInMethod

private void executeCorrectFileInMethod()
When the user tries to load or save a store object from / to a file, we need to work out if this is an RMI file or a local file, and execute the correct file save and load methods. This is particularly useful as it allows us to use some of the same methods and aids in the fact that a lot of store saves are done automatically without the user's knowledge

loadEditTimetableGUI

private void loadEditTimetableGUI()
Creates a new editTimestableGUI object and displays it

loadEditResultsGUI

private void loadEditResultsGUI()
Creates a new editResultsGUI object and displays it

loadEditMessagesGUI

private void loadEditMessagesGUI()
Creates a new editMessagesGUI object and displays it

createNewStore

private void createNewStore()
Creates a new store object to work with and set the appropriate GUI 'mode' (i.e. cleared text fields and reset record pointer)

loadExitDialog

private void loadExitDialog()
Creates a dialog to be displayed when the user tries to exit and displays it, prompting the user if they wish to exit in case they have made a mistake

nextPointer

private void nextPointer()
Displays the next student record object details from the student records store

previousPointer

private void previousPointer()
Displays the previous student record object details from the student records store

firstPointer

private void firstPointer()
Displays the first student record object details from the student records store

lastPointer

private void lastPointer()
Displays the last student record object details from the student records store

removeRecord

private void removeRecord()
Removes a student record from the student record store, in which one of two methods will be run depending on the mode of the GUI. I.e. if the user made a 'search' then the results of that search (or filter) will have created a new student records store to navigate through, which consists of only those 'filtered' student records. This has an impact when trying to remove a record, as ideally if the user has performed a search, then we want to keep the results of that search. So performing this search will either remove the record from the main store only or both the main store AND filter store

remove_fromSearched

private void remove_fromSearched()
Removes a student records from the student records store and is called if the user performs a remove record after a student record search has been made

See Also:
removeRecord()

remove_fromNotSerached

private void remove_fromNotSerached()
Removes a student records from the student records store and is called if the user performs a remove record after a student record search hasn't been made

See Also:
removeRecord()

setEditMode

private void setEditMode()
Sets the GUI to be in 'edit' mode - i.e. specific text fields become editable and navigation buttons are set to disabled

setNewRecordMode

private void setNewRecordMode()
Sets the GUI to be in 'new record' mode - i.e. A new element is added to the end of the student record object array list in the store object and the text fields are set to empty

saveStore

private void saveStore()
Saves the current store to a file that has already been loaded The method in which the save is performed will be different depending on what 'mode' the GUI is currently in i.e. if a search has been made or if a new record has been created. This type of save is executed by the program automatically rather than via a user command

See Also:
removeRecord()

save_newRecord

private void save_newRecord()
Performs the save operation when the GUI is in 'new record created' mode

See Also:
saveStore()

save_searched

private void save_searched()
Performs the save operation when the GUI is in 'hasSearched' mode

See Also:
saveStore()

saveFileAs

private void saveFileAs()
Saves the current store to a file specified by the user. The file name and file location is set via the Swing's file chooser dialog which prompts the user. This method also allows a user to decide if they wish to override an existing file or not, which is in the form of another dialog, created also by this method

saveFile

public void saveFile()
Runs the actual methods to save the student records store file - This method is called as an end result determined by a complicated series of validations by prior 'pre-save' methods. It will run one of two save operation based on the 'mode' of the GUI. I.e. a RMI save will be performed if the store is a remote store or a local save is the store is local

See Also:
saveStore(), saveFileAs(), save_searched(), save_newRecord()

saveRMIFile

protected void saveRMIFile()
Saves the current store to a pre-defined RMI location

See Also:
saveFile()

search

private void search()
Performs a search through the student records store and created a new filtered store which is then displayed. The search is performed on the student ID number or the student surname, from the value in the 'search' text field. The search performed is not a 'whole word match' but can be a substring of the searched results

setNoRecordsAvailableMode

private void setNoRecordsAvailableMode()
Is called when there exists no student records in a store, and it sets the appropriate GUI 'mode' - i.e. buttons disabled and text fields un-editable

openRMIFile

protected void openRMIFile()
Loads a student records store from a pre-defined RMI location

openFile

private void openFile()
Loads a student records store from a local file, which is determined via the user's choice when the select a file from the Swing file chooser created in this method.

updatePhoto

private void updatePhoto()
Method to update the student records photo image. It uses Swing's file chooser to specify the image and save it to the student record object

setRecord

public void setRecord()
Sets the appropriate text fields to show the details of the student record object

clearTextFields

private void clearTextFields()
Clears the text fields on the Record GUI

createNewRecord

private void createNewRecord()
Creates a new student record for the student records store. It also determines the student ID number based on what is currently stored in the store object and randomly generates a student pin number (this pin number can be changed at a later date, the student ID number however has to be unique, and it cannot be changed).

randomPinGenerator

private int randomPinGenerator()
Generates a random 4 digit pin number

Returns:
actualPinNumber The randomly generated pin number

validateAndStore

private void validateAndStore()
Method to validate the values in the text fields of the Records GUI upon a 'save edit' or 'save new' record execution before performing the actual save to file operation. It validates the fields to discover a possible human error entry in one or more of the fields and informs. An example is making sure that the telephone text field has no letters in it. Some of the validation is done by an instance of the 'Field Validator' class

relaventFieldsAreEmpty

private boolean relaventFieldsAreEmpty()
Method to check if any required fields are empty before performing a store save

Returns:
someFieldsAreEmpty If they are empty or not
